intro: Triumfetta josefina, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Triumfetta josefina is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
